website_summaries.verdict: Irresistibly colorful, this toy begs to be bitten. While it might not last very long at the mercy of bigger beaks, most birds get immense pleasure out of taking this destructible toy apart.
pros: Bright colors attract even the most introverted birds
Wooden blocks deliver a satisfying chew
Plastic beads and pacifiers are fun to rattle and shake
Loaded with different shapes, sizes, and textures to encourage exploration and physical activity
Sized just right for smaller birds
Beads and pacifiers can be picked up recycled
cons: Big birds are likely to destroy this toy faster than others on this list

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. I am a big advocate of giving him ...
customer_reviews.text: A big thumbs up. My SI male Eclectus played with it the MOMENT I put it on top of his cage and he's still toying with it a half hour later. I haven't even gotten the chance to affix it to his cage yet! Very satisfied. I am a big advocate of giving him lots of stimulating toys and I'm always on the lookout for new products.
customer_reviews.author: Moira N.

customer_reviews.title: CAG Loves this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a plucking African Grey so I keep trying various toys to keep her busy with something besides pulling and barbering her own feathers. She took to this toy immediately, so I'm a happy camper. hasn't stopped plucking, vet report showed high triglycerides, so I'm hoping better diet, regular flying practice (she couldn't and I'm guessing that may have started the plucking) brings her around. I've only had her 6 months and I'm seeing general strength and well being improvements, so I'll keep doing what I'm doing! (Which is also what the vet suggested)
customer_reviews.author: L. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: probably good toy for tiny birds.
customer_reviews.text: This was a cute little toy for a cheap price. I bought it thinking my bird would destroy in a day or two. She destroyed in less than 20 mins. She broke one piece and the whole thing fell apart. She had the most fun from c-clamp. Nothing incorrect about description, just cheaper than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: My parrot loves these things!
customer_reviews.text: My African grey really likes these! He’s a rescued plucker so it’s important he has things to chew on other than himself - large toys frighten him. He destroys the wood pieces first then goes after the shoestrings. When the beads fall we collect them and either restring or put on a caribeaner clip for additional fun. Perfect size for a small fearful African grey. We like the colorful pop they add to his play space and the affordability.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Chan

customer_reviews.title: Bird loves it --but the cotton cords are dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Bird loves it --but the cotton cords are dangerous. It took my lovebird about 20 minutes to untie the knots at the ends of the dangly parts. All the beads and wooden bits fell to the bottom of the cage and left 4 inches of bare, frayed cotton shoe-lace rope hanging down. Lovebirds can hang or choke themselves on ropes like this, as well as ingest the fibers if they're chewers (like mine is). I had to remove the toy immediately. I will use the little parts to make something he cannot unravel so easily.
customer_reviews.author: J. O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: great toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: just arrived in the mail. its cute and a decent size for the price. i hope the birds like it. my only concern with the toy is that it is strung together with a fabric cord. hopefully my birds dont figure out how to break the bottom so everything just falls of... once the toy is destroyed, i'll salvage the good pieces and make a new toy with new wood pieces and the old plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Instant hit
customer_reviews.text: My little African red belly loved it. Lasted him a week, there is still 1 well chewed piece left, but surely not for long. Was inexpensive. kept him entertained. I dont mind it went quick just shows how much he enjoyed it, sometimes toys last months, I just throw those away because they get filthy and apparently weren't interesting enough, although I have some great plastic ones that wash up well and get lots of attention. I will definitly be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: CDA

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and Fun
customer_reviews.text: My little Karen hated this toy at first. She was very apprehensive and was very aggressive with it. She did not like the toy hanging in her cage. After a little coaching and familiarization, she started to warm up to the toy. She stil does not like it hanging in her cage. But she plays with it when the toy is in her favorite toy box (just a plain old small wooden box where I put her toys).
customer_reviews.author: YSJZ

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: My complaint about this toy is there are plastic pieces on the toy and they are circular which is fine but they had very sharp edges on them. Almost like a thorn. I was just going to put the toy in my parrots cage since he was so excited to see it. But one of the “thorns” stabbed me and I came to realize there were about 10 of them on the toy I had to cut off to make it safe for my pet. Wasn’t happy about that. He could really gotten hurt.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: My Amazon Demolished the Whole thing in a Month
customer_reviews.text: It's great looking. But with a larger parrot it isnt going to last. Mine happily tore the thing down to it's strings in no time. Consider it disposable. Use it for conure sized parrots, or smaller. but not African Greys, Amazons or Macaw sized birds. One of the problems of ordering bird toys online :/
customer_reviews.author: Window Kitty

customer_reviews.title: My bird took to it right away. I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: My bird took to it right away. I thought it would take him a couple days to get through it. It took about 15 minutes for the pieces to be all over the floor and the floor of the cage.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Ferrante

customer_reviews.title: My green cheeked conure enjoys it
customer_reviews.text: My kids wanted the bird to get a Christmas present. This was cheap and seemed like something he would enjoy chewing up. He's a greem cheeked conure and it's a little bigger than he is. He already enjoys chewing on the little plastic binky things. Would recommend for a conure.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for the money
customer_reviews.text: this a well built toy, full of things to chew on. comes with a quicklink which is way safer than those pinch clips. doesnt have much wood or shreddable things but this toy will last for a super long time. easy to clean too. great toy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: My Birds are in Love with These Toys
customer_reviews.text: My Sun Conures love these toys. There is soft wood to crack and shred, soft ropes to pulls and shred, and beads to fall off as they work the knots out. These never fail to please.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This product came undone in a few weeks it came undone almost choked my parrot to death. He was screaming for help. Luckily I work from home and saw him and was able to help. Threw it right in the trash. Please buy another product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our conure loved it
customer_reviews.text: Our sun conure started clicking at this toy the second he saw it hanging in his home. He then began climbing on it and then the chewing started. When I got home from work, there wasn't much left and today it's mostly gone. I'm going to get more for him.
customer_reviews.author: Spicejar

customer_reviews.title: Small for an Amazon but still loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Amazon and it's a bit small for her but she loves it regardless. All the wood has long since been chewed off but she still likes to jingle the plastic bits and rattle it against the cage and hang from it. My bird's not a big shoe lace chewer (which is what this is strung from) so it's lasted quite a while. Good buy for my bird!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: My bird loved this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sun conure and she absolutely loved playing with it. However, she did manage to destroy it in a matter of weeks. It was a great value for my money as a similar toy at my nearest pet store was more than double the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zee Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Recommend. Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Tiny and wouldn't hold up to a parakeet. Ordered it thinking it was larger and would give my blue and gold macaw a toy. NOT. Piece of junk. No wonder it was an add on. I used to raise small birds and this wouldn't hold up to much of anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Sharp plastic pieces
customer_reviews.text: It’s big for the price, however I ordered 2 and they both have sharp pieces of plastic that stick out on the beads and cracked wood pieces. I will maybe keep and supervise my birds when playing with it, but worried about them getting cut on the sharp pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is Jack’s favorite toy out of every toy. I recently just bought three more because he just loves it so much I don’t know what it is about those pacifiers but it really attracts him. And the price on these toys I don’t think anyplace can beat Amazon for bird toys and dog things and pretty much anything.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M.

customer_reviews.title: So...smaller than I thought it would be - perfect for parakeet/lovebird size...
customer_reviews.text: That being said, my goffin destroyed it in a day - BUT - she LOVES the little wavy wafers and I had just bought a 100% mop head to make toys for her and I cleaned and rethreaded all the wafers and she LOVES untying all those knots and dropping the wafers to the floor. She likes this SO MUCH that I just ordered two more so I can have a pile of premade toys for her to tear up using the beads and wafers over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Reggie
customer_reviews.text: My sun conure had this destroyed in just a couple days. That's what they do. He sure had fun with it while it lasted though. I put all the peices in a bucket for him and he still picks them up and plays sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: The birds looked at this for a few days, then they attacked. The wood was destroyed in about an hour. The rest is still in tact. Pretty good quality. The birds still play with it. they shake the strings around. It has lasted longer than some other toys. I bought some other ones that had plastic pieces that lasted for a day. My birds just destroyed the plastic, they didn't eat them they are parrots they are not stupid. These pieces are more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great!
customer_reviews.text: My two love birds are nibbling at the wooden blocks, but that's about it. Which is fine, because I see them interacting with this on a daily basis. This toy might last a while at this rate, but it doesn't mean it's a bad toy. Just not one they're crazy about.
customer_reviews.author: Franzheska Maysonet

customer_reviews.title: Small bird toy.
customer_reviews.text: My bird didn’t really care for this toy. I could see other birds enjoying it. It is a small toy. I have a medium size cockatoo. The toy is a great for an empty corner of a cage. I think my bird just doesn’t care about plastic. Other birds may very well like it.
customer_reviews.author: ShannyBird

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it so much I ordered 2 more!! Great for eccies, conures ring necks and more! Side note dont let a macaw play with it, it will be gone in 2 seconds haha
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: 70 YR OLD LODA LOVES THIS TOY
customer_reviews.text: Loda is a 70 yr old orange wing Amazon she loves this bright color chew toy. She loves the different shapes & material you can hear her mumbling as she plays
customer_reviews.author: Betty Forester

customer_reviews.title: Phoenix loves it!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package I was excited it came in a huge package (also with my food scale) so I though hey the toy will be pretty big. But when I pulled it out it was pretty small. When I got home I put it in Phoenix’s cage right away at forest she was scared of it, as soon as I left she started tearing it apart! Perfect toy exactly what I hoped for. Phoenix took it and she loves destroying it! I can’t ask for a better toy for my Sunday conure!
customer_reviews.author: Kris05

customer_reviews.title: Great for small birds
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Cockatoo, and he had it torn apart the first day I hung it in his cage. It's a great little toy, but I would suggest purchasing it for smaller birds, such as parakeets or parrotlets.
customer_reviews.author: PenderRedHed

customer_reviews.title: Stuff, hard to play with
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty butthe pieces are tightly packed against one another. That may work for some birds, but ours like toys they can manipulate a bit. We have 2 budgies, 1 conure and a cockatiel. None of them wanted anything to do with this.
customer_reviews.author: Khanfam05

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as pictured, but...
customer_reviews.text: but my bird really enjoys it, especially the wooden bits, although he likes the wafers too. Mine didn't have the little plastic pacifiers at the bottom, but that was not a big deal. I will definitely order again and hope they come up with more fun designs for my little hard-to-please guy. ;) I have re-ordered this three times now. The product was always okay and my little brat LOVES them.
customer_reviews.author: nowyat

customer_reviews.title: what a steal!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this toy was a steal! It's a really good size, made with ropes and not the elastic-y stuff that my bird can cut in one chop. She loves biting on the wood pieces which is good for help keeping their beaks trimmed down and is a big fan of the pacifiers. It's holding up very well and for the price point I ended up ordering another one when she's able to destroy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda N Isbell

customer_reviews.title: Good deal !
customer_reviews.text: Toy is definitely worth the money ! My Sun Conure has had it in his cage for 2 weeks and has not destroyed it. Definitely a good value. Recommended !
customer_reviews.author: Katharine L.

customer_reviews.title: Finicky cockatiels love to chew on it
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiels seem to hate toys. But they love to chew on this. I was expecting this to last like a week based on the reviews but now it seems like it will last a few months. Great toy for the price, will buy again when my birds take it out of commission.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Chaco says “SQUAWK!!! Good toy!”
customer_reviews.text: Chaco loves this toy a lot and it’s still hanging in there months later. Good price too our local pet store charges ten times what we paid!
customer_reviews.author: CandyGram

customer_reviews.title: Happy bird
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bird toy. Well made very good materials. Bird seems to like it very much(a Parrotlet). Reasonably priced. Better than others
customer_reviews.author: rosanne

customer_reviews.title: For midsized birds fun! Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for midsized birds. Too small for larger parrots, in my opinion, but great love the colors and so do my birds.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy
customer_reviews.text: Kiwi, my Blue Crown Conure loved this, but bit the plastic hanging toys off, which presented a risk to the bird. I would not recommend for any bird with powerful beak/bite power.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: My Sun Conures loved this toy. They can destroy wood quickly, but the plastic is very durable. They love chewing and moving the plastic parts around.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Birds do like to chew and play but this toy didn't last ...
customer_reviews.text: Birds do like to chew and play but this toy didn't last an hour, I have an African Grey, Not a big bird, but is a parrot and it is not strong enough to hold up to anything bigger than a parakeet.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Indian ring neck says thank you!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Indian ring neck absolutely loves this toy!!!!! I would say this is his absolute favorite!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa w.

customer_reviews.title: Too small for large parrot
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a joke! It showed with a large parrot making you think this was a large toy. It would work for a cockatiel but certainly not for anything bigger and NOT for the size of fire it showed in the photo!
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sized toy for a small to medium sized bird. My green cheek conure loves them toy and plays with it daily. Once she chews through it I will definitely be purchasing another one. It’s a great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rolling Home RV Rentals

customer_reviews.title: This sun conure approves
customer_reviews.text: It seems safe and it's owner the bird likes it - she's making rather quick work of it but it's still a good toy, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Offie

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy at a great price
customer_reviews.text: My Amazons just love this!! They chew and play with it for hours at a time! I try to keep a good mix of toys in the cage and on their playtree. The price is excellent! I will purchase this one again!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks cute, but poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: In no time flat, this toy was completely destroyed by Sweet Pea, the one bird demolition squad! Other toys have been up to the challenge, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cellomama

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to add for your African Grey!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 29 year old African Grey, Romeo. He loves it! Perfect toy that is not overwhelming and so far, seems to be keeping him very amused.
customer_reviews.author: christine c

customer_reviews.title: Very cute !!
customer_reviews.text: A very cute toy ! Colorful and looks great . My Sun Conure will surely love it !
customer_reviews.author: Gina F.

customer_reviews.title: The dye coloring was too heavy on the wood of the toy.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the wooden blocks had way too much food coloring on it. I had to wash the toys several times. I actually would have preferred natural wood alongside the lovely plastic rings. The dye coloring was way to heavy. Am sorry to express my first dislike on anything .
customer_reviews.author: Renee Edens

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my bird.
customer_reviews.text: My green cheeked conure is a destroyer of all things chewable. He was tentative for the first couple of days but has since taken a lovely chomping to the wooden bits. I like to lodge little bits of millet and Lafeber's nutriberries/popcorn treats in the plastic parts. I won't say it's his favorite toy, but it's a good runner up.
customer_reviews.author: PBallz

customer_reviews.title: cute toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: nice colors, but I'm not sure if my birds will take to it or not. Most new toys they explore immediately...not this one. Will update review if this changes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bird Toy
customer_reviews.text: Our conure loves this toy. She swings, chews and talks to this toy. Great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They will use it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome toy. I was sure glad she took to it. I think what she liked is the little plastic toy at he ends. Very good size for my Green cheek conure
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R.G. Samms

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Bird
customer_reviews.text: I love this. The only drawback is that it is too small for my cockatoo. Would buy again if I had a smaller bird.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Smells
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute toy which is made of wood and plastic however after opening the package I noticed a smell. I can’t put my finger on the odor but it has a old stagnant smell like it’s been stored with mothballs or other chemicals that has permeated the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Medium bird toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is designed for small parrots or medium birds but my large macaw is chewing the heck out of it lol
customer_reviews.author: terri

customer_reviews.title: Our birds love taking his toy apart
customer_reviews.text: Oh what fun. Our birds take it apart and we restring it. A truly ongoing fun experience for our birds and us.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy for my Indian ringneck.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great size for my cockatiel and Indian ringneck. They both like to play with it and so far it is taking my ringneck lots longer to destroy it then many toys I have bought for him. He loves to try though, and that makes it a great buy. It is fun for him and lasts a long time so I don't have to spend so much money to keep him happy and occupied.
customer_reviews.author: MERI

customer_reviews.title: Good value, long lasting...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a few days for my Alexandrine. He was very entertained for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty J.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Rat pays no attention to this at all. Still made well and colorful
customer_reviews.author: Asteroth66

customer_reviews.title: Safe and fun
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! Safe and fun, good price. I don't have to worry about what materials were used to make the toy when I buy from super bird. I've ordered toys made by other companies from amazon before and they were clearly made by people who weren't familiar with what's safe in a bird toy. But super bird always comes through. This toy is a good size for small birds up to medium conures.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Careful if your bird is a super chewer.
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything but the large wood pieces. My cockatiel chewed right through them in about an hour. I had to take it away because the splinters were so thin and sharp. Otherwise it is a good toy.
customer_reviews.author: Terpen

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: My sun conure chewed through the rope part in a day before I even knew it. She enjoyed the bright wooden pieces and chewing them to bits until she’d drop them through the bars. Fine toy, but it didn’t last long, so...
customer_reviews.author: James Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Nice parrot toy
customer_reviews.text: nice inexpensive parrt toy for a medium bird.. conure size. My IRN loves it
customer_reviews.author: Linda Henderson

customer_reviews.title: The "wafers" are thin plastic which my beakers would snap ...
customer_reviews.text: The "wafers" are thin plastic which my beakers would snap in a minute and spread little plastic crumbs and shards all over. I will not put this near the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Nice parrot toy
customer_reviews.text: It was cute and nice toy. I will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great size for my green cheek conures and my cockatiel and also my Meyers parrot. I reordered more as my pineapple green cheek conure dove on his to play with. My older gcc occasionally beats it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nowell

customer_reviews.title: Sun Conure Loved it
customer_reviews.text: My Conure loved this toy! Took her a few months to completely dismantle it... But she loved it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Bird toys
customer_reviews.text: Nice bird toy but some of the plastic bits were broken on receipt
customer_reviews.author: Leila

customer_reviews.title: Good value, safe toy.
customer_reviews.text: My Conure LOVED this. She disaasembled it fairily quickly, but the plastic parts held strong and I used them to make another toy.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Just for filler space
customer_reviews.text: I have a macaw so this was just to fill up space on a wall in his cage. Won’t last a day but it’s fun for him. Decent size for the price.
customer_reviews.author: leandraTop Contributor: Activewear

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for medium birds?
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, but perhaps not really meant for bigger birds. My blue front Amazon parrot had this almost completely destroyed in mere hours. She had a lot of fun, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not healthy for your bird! If it falls into the water it will bleed into the water and be toxic.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy until my bird destroyed it and it went into her water and dyed the water which makes me very concerned about how healthy it is for her. Not comfortable with this after that.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: My green cheeked conures love it
customer_reviews.text: My parrots love this! They are massive chewers and this toy has held up!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great toy in good price
customer_reviews.text: One of my bird's favorite toys. This was his second one and he managed to crack 70% of it in one day. First one took him more than a week. But - my alexandrine is skilled plastic/wood expert. :)
customer_reviews.author: L.D.

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: The wooden parts were destroyed quickly by my African Gray. She still plays with the plastic rings.
customer_reviews.author: Katyabird

customer_reviews.title: the little pacifiers on the ends fit in his mouth perfectly so its super cute when he picks them up
customer_reviews.text: Our conure loves this. I don't 100% trust him with the cotton sting they are tied on yet so we use it outside his cage while hes supervised. the little pacifiers on the ends fit in his mouth perfectly so its super cute when he picks them up. lol
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: something new for the birds
customer_reviews.text: The birds like to have different things in their cage, so I swap out toys and put others in. Works great at keeping them happy.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for large
customer_reviews.text: Did not last. My parrot had this destroyed in under 5 mins. Lots of little plastic rings everyware. Not recommended for large birds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My pionus liked this toy
customer_reviews.text: My pionus liked this toy. Took him a while to chew through the wood parts, but after that it's pretty useless. He's not interested in playing with the plastic parts. Would probably purchase a fully wood toy over this one, but given it's price point it's a nice buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My male parrot is not as happy with this as I thought he would be
customer_reviews.text: My male parrot is not as happy with this as I thought he would be. I moved it to my females cage and she's only mildly interested as well.
customer_reviews.author: Magumbo32

customer_reviews.title: Chewable, but solid!
customer_reviews.text: My conure loves it. He can chew some parts, and play with other. Does not fall apart like other chewable toys.
customer_reviews.author: Mehwish

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price. Perfect for Sun Conure and Quaker Parakeet.
customer_reviews.text: Size was great. Half the price of similar items at the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy !
customer_reviews.text: Great fun toy for our Amazon ! He loved it and it took him a while before he destroyed it ! I'll be buying this toy again !
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: so not a total waste, should have read others and asked how big ...
customer_reviews.text: My cockatoo destroyed this in 15 minutes flat! And never left the top of her cage she jsut pulled it thru the bars and demolished it. But she still chews on the wood and the rings. but i was thinking the rings would be bigger. so not a total waste, should have read others and asked how big it was...
customer_reviews.author: Mary Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an add on item. Well worth the price. Nice toy for medium birds.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: My blue crowned conure flipped over this toy
customer_reviews.text: Luckily, I bought a few of these because my blue crowned conure adores it!
customer_reviews.author: Francie

customer_reviews.title: Bird toy
customer_reviews.text: My gold capped conjure love this little toy. She plays with it all the time. Very colorful!! And well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 different species of parrots (green cheek, Quaker, sun conure, and Indian ringneck,) and they all love these toys!
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller parrots LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased several of these. I have a Sun Conure and a Quaker. There are really attracted to the bright colors. And they’re very strong. I would definitely purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Native Amer Soap Artist

customer_reviews.title: bird toy
customer_reviews.text: My bird tore it apart in a few hours. I think there are better and longer lasting toys available
customer_reviews.author: gol girl

customer_reviews.title: Good for cockatiel
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel loves this toy, the wood and plastic are great for him to chew on and he likes to stand on it as well
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Melms

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition to the birds toys at a great price compared to pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Graham

customer_reviews.title: My Parrot’s favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: Our African gray loves this so much, I bought two and he went through them in less than one day.
customer_reviews.author: Simone WS

customer_reviews.title: African Grey like it
customer_reviews.text: Good Small Toy, it was destroyed but my African Grey had fun.
customer_reviews.author: ChiTownChic

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for small birds!
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel loves the clicking sounds that the plastic loops make when she shakes the toy. Made of plastic rings on cotton shoe laces, this is a fairly sturdy toy for cockatiels and smaller. A month later and even after daily play, still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: My parrot loves this toy. He picks it up and puts it on his back for some reason and enjoys playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: zoey

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and so does my Amazon. I couldn't make it for the price I bought it for. I'll buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: cute toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 for my cages the birds love them and chew the blocks a lot
customer_reviews.author: Taff

product_meta.title: Super Bird Creations SB736 Wiggles and Wafers Colorful Chewable Wooden Bird Toy with Blocks and Pacifiers, Medium Size, 3” x 5” x 9”
product_meta.description: Color:VariesBirds are naturally drawn towards colorful and moving objects. Their beaks instinctually chew any item They are close enough to reach. Proper chewing is necessary to provide them with the play and exercise they need to maintain optimal physical and mental health. Give your pet the right cage accessory to enjoy! super bird creations developed this fun and attractive wiggles and wafers toy for medium size birds: a heavy duty, colorful set of plastic and wood wafers, beads, blocks, and pacifiers in bright yellow, Blue, orange, green, purple, and red carefully selected and placed on four laces to provide your pet bird with the exercise and fun It needs to stay happy and healthy. ideal for caciques, conjures, Quakers, and ring necks, this chewable bird cage accessory is ready to be shredded by your bird in an energy-boosting playtime session.
feature_bullets: For Medium birds – The wiggles and wafers bird toy by Super Bird Creations is the perfect size for ring necks, Medium Conjures, Quakers, Caciques, pious, Senegal's and similarly sized pet birds.

Design features – This fun bird toy is crafted with the finest quality wooden parts, brightly colored Wiggle beads and translucent pacifiers. Utilizing a diverse selection of stimulating materials, colors, textures and shapes make Super Bird Creations toys of maximum interest to pet birds.

Enrichment benefits - The wiggles and wafers bird toy is designed to not only entertain with its numerous fun to explore Wiggle rings and pacifiers but its colorful, fun to chew wooden slats will also satisfy your pet bird's instinctual chewing behavior.

Relieves boredom – properly designed bird toys are more than “just toys”. Super Bird Creations parrot toys are “playthings with a purpose” that help to ward off boredom, depression, aggression and destructive behaviors in parrots by stimulating physical activity, curiosity and mental engagement.

Bird safe components & design – Recommended by avian professionals worldwide, our products are expertly designed to maximize the safety and enrichment benefits to pet parrots. Bird owners can be confident that only the finest toy components are used. Proudly assembled in the USA since 1992.
